subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_6bb92e42-9f4a-4d02-b159-49320e33aeac_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Nick,
 
You are a new member and a possible researcher so I do not want to=
 get off on the wrong foot
It sounds like you may have taken what I said as=
 criticism, It was not meant to be.
Just experienced advice. There are some=
 researchers that believe it is beneficial to leave 
a box running and unat=
tended, so that our spirit friends can "imprint" to the frequency of the bo=
x
 
That is not at all necessary, Spirit techs do need to imprint to certai=
n boxes but do so through two way communication
you see they also imprint t=
he energy signature of the user of the box also. And that can only be accom=
plished through 
communicative interaction during a session. If the box is =
left unattended they may only accomplish half of what they need to do.
 
Al=
so I have had first hand experience with certain researchers that do practi=
ce this lackadaisical us of a box and had begun to 
get less and less commu=
nication during attempts at actual sessions and eventually nothing but nega=
tive entities coming through.
I am not saying this is solely due to doing a=
n absent session which is what I have come to call it, It entails man6y fac=
tors.
 
But the absent session practice definitely contributes to the ultim=
ate failure of communication. 
Nick, it is better for you to establish soli=
d research practices in the beginning that will serve to enhance your commu=
nication 
skills and growth in the future.
 
Remember your spirit contacts =
or "technicians" will become not only the facilitators of your link and com=
munication from the
other side but they will become your trusted friends an=
d protectors. you would never leave your buddy on the phone and go 
on to s=
omething else while he remained on the line calling for you to speak with h=
im. Our spirit friends where people just like us
at one time and the emotio=
ns we carry in the physical also carry over to our spirit lives.
 
I hope y=
ou do not take this as preaching or criticism it is just experience from co=
mmunicating with my own techs and friends
and gathering information on what=
 they feel and expect from us as researchers.
Remember all we have to do is=
 turn on a box and listen and record their job to send the communication 
n=
o matter how short the phrase or word is a 1000x harder for them so don't y=
ou think they deserve a 100% 
of our attention when we open the lines of co=
mmunication.
 
Also in closing let me say that my belief on "imprinting" of=
 a box is for boxes like Frank's box and the mini box, for the simple
reaso=
n that they are individually made and each carry a slightly different frequ=
ency range, indicative to that particular box.
The radio shack hack box on =
the other hand is manufactured in china most likely on an automated assembl=
y line so each
circuit board is exactly like the next, this being the case =
I believe that when our friends imprinted on the first of the RS boxes
it w=
as sufficient for most of the others. That is why people experience immedia=
te communication right out of the box.
 
So therefore the RS box does not n=
eed that grace period to "Imprint"
 
These comments and statements are my o=
wn hypothesis based on my own extensive research with every type of box tha=
t is made to date
and I am only offering it so that it may help others to a=
void the toil and mistakes that I have endured.
 
thanks for giving me the =
soap box once again!
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comF=
rom: thegreatwolf@...: Wed, 9 Jan 2008 06:25:30 -0500Subject:=
 Re: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning




Just FYI, I had stopped checking my e=
mail at that time and was trying to get someone to say something.  I usuall=
y can't get my self to not pay attention to the box when i turn it on.

On =
Jan 8, 2008, at 9:19 AM, bruce halliday wrote:




Nick, My advice as a lon=
g time researcher is not to just turn the box on and leave it running unles=
s you intend to do a session and give your friends on the other side that a=
re workingextremely hard to send you the communication your undivided atten=
tion. It's kind of like calling someone on the phone and when they start a =
conversation you decide toput the phone down and focus your attention on ot=
her things. There are other researchers that feel that there is nothing wro=
ng with this practice and do it on occasionBut I have come to the understan=
ding that it is deemed disrespectful and while you may be listening with on=
e ear as you do something else, you will hear a loud curse word or nasty st=
atement, that is their way of getting your attention back. I have gotten nu=
merous messages about the difficulty of the attempts for them to communicat=
e so when I turn the box on it gets my full attention. just some experience=
d advice. As for them telling you to close the portal, it could have two me=
anings. Sometimes they refer to box thatis turned on and in use as a portal=
 for the simple reason that each time we turn a box on to communicate it op=
ens a direct open link between our realm and theirs so in essence it is an =
open door for anything to pass in or out. that is why when I end a session =
I always ask my technician to bring back any spirits that may have come thr=
ough the portal during the session and I ask for conformation and 10 times =
out of ten will get "OK" or "OK THEY ARE BACK" also they may have meant sin=
ce you had the box running and where not doing a actual session to shut the=
 box so that they could go and not have to protect the open connection from=
 any negative entities that where able cross through the openportal. A few =
researchers have been receiving numerous messages about the number 7 within=
 the past month. The only known significance that the number 7 has in evp r=
esearch is the 7 entities that controlled communication back in the eightie=
s and ninetiesduring the spiricom and luxembourg era. To receive this numbe=
r in messages so often and by more than one researcher, odiouslyholds some =
importance which they have not been able or are not ready to convey. If you=
 need any help or have any questions please feel free to ask. Bruce
Bruce H=
alliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: thegreatwolf@...:=
 Tue, 8 Jan 2008 06:27:07 -0500Subject: [EVP-ITC] Box in the morning


Hey,=
Anyone have any odd problems in the morning with using it. I am sitting her=
e checking my email so i just thought i'd turn it on and... not check my em=
ail. Anywho.... Then right at about 6:20 i heard a voice say "Nicholas Ethe=
ridge please turn off the dsfnlsd" not quite sure what word it used... poss=
ibly portal. I just thought it was weird. Also under all of the jumble and =
this voice speaking i heard a deep male voice almost chanting "seven". Not =
sure if I actually heard this or its the want to have an excuse to stay hom=
e and not take the HSAs.Anyway.. just curious if anyone has gotten heard th=
is or if they know something I don't about using the box in the morning.Pea=
ce,Nick

ow!

 <BR>
You are a new member and a possible resear=
cher so I do not want to get off on the wrong foot<BR>
It sounds like you m=
ay have taken what I said as criticism, It was not meant to be.<BR>
Just ex=
perienced advice. There are some researchers that believe it is beneficial =
to leave <BR>
a box running and unattended, so that our spirit friends can =
"imprint" to the frequency of the box<BR>
 <BR>
That is not at all nec=
essary, Spirit techs do need to imprint to certain boxes but do so through =
two way communication<BR>
you see they also imprint the energy signature of=
 the user of the box also. And that can only be accomplished through <BR>
c=
ommunicative interaction during a session. If the box is left unattended th=
ey may only accomplish half of what they need to do.<BR>
 <BR>
Also I =
have had first hand experience with certain researchers that do practice th=
is lackadaisical us of a box and had begun to <BR>
get less and less commun=
ication during attempts at actual sessions and eventually nothing but negat=
ive entities coming through.<BR>
I am not saying this is solely due to doin=
g an absent session which is what I have come to call it, It entails man6y =
factors.<BR>
 <BR>
But the absent session practice definitely contribu=
tes to the ultimate failure of communication. <BR>
Nick, it is better for y=
ou to establish solid research practices in the beginning that will serve t=
o enhance your communication <BR>
skills and growth in the future.<BR>
&nbs=
p;<BR>
Remember your spirit contacts or "technicians" will become not only =
the facilitators of your link and communication from the<BR>
other side but=
 they will become your trusted friends and protectors. you would never=
 leave your buddy on the phone and go <BR>
on to something else while he re=
mained on the line calling for you to speak with him. Our spirit friends wh=
ere people just like us<BR>
at one time and the emotions we carry in the ph=
ysical also carry over to our spirit lives.<BR>
 <BR>
I hope you do no=
t take this as preaching or criticism it is just experience from communicat=
ing with my own techs and friends<BR>
and gathering information on what the=
y feel and expect from us as researchers.<BR>
Remember all we have to do is=
 turn on a box and listen and record their job to send the communication <B=
R>
no matter how short the phrase or word is a 1000x harder for them so don=
't you think they deserve a 100% <BR>
of our attention when we open the lin=
es of communication.<BR>
 <BR>
Also in closing let me say that my beli=
ef on "imprinting" of a box is for boxes like Frank's box and the mini box,=
 for the simple<BR>
reason that they are individually made and each carry a=
 slightly different frequency range, indicative to that particular box.<BR>=

The radio shack hack box on the other hand is manufactured in china most l=
ikely on an automated assembly line so each<BR>
circuit board is exactly li=
ke the next, this being the case I believe that when our friends imprinted =
on the first of the RS boxes<BR>
it was sufficient for most of the others. =
That is why people experience immediate communication right out of the box.=
<BR>
 <BR>
So therefore the RS box does not need that grace period to =
"Imprint"<BR>
 <BR>
These comments and statements are my own hypothesi=
s based on my own extensive research with every type of box that is made to=
 date<BR>
and I am only offering it so that it may help others to avoid the=
 toil and mistakes that I have endured.<BR>
 <BR>
thanks for giving me=
 the soap box once again!<BR>
 <BR>
Bruce<BR><BR><BR>
